name: Calcium Propionate
description: A commonly used food preservative that prevents mold growth and extends the shelf life of bread and baked goods.

name: Citric Acid
description: A widely used food ingredient used to add a tart and sour flavor to food and beverages, and as a preservative to extend shelf life.

name: Sodium Propionate
description: A food preservative used to extend the shelf life of baked goods and dairy products, and to prevent mold growth.

name: Potassium Sorbate
description: A food preservative used to prevent mold and yeast growth in a wide range of food products, including cheese, wine, and dried fruits.

name: Sodium Benzoate
description: A food preservative used to prevent spoilage caused by bacteria and fungi in acidic food and beverage products, including soft drinks and fruit juices.

name: L-Cysteine
description: An amino acid used as a dough conditioner in baked goods, such as bread and pastries, to improve the texture and extend shelf life.

name: Propionic Acid
description: A food preservative used to prevent mold growth in baked goods, dairy products, and other food products, and as a flavor enhancer.

name: Ascorbic Acid
description: A water-soluble antioxidant used to prevent the oxidation of food products, such as fruits and vegetables, and to maintain their color and flavor.

name: Tocopherols
description: A group of naturally occurring antioxidants used to prevent oxidation and spoilage in a variety of food products, including oils, fats, and meats.

name: Monocalcium Phosphate
description: A leavening agent used in baking to produce carbon dioxide, which helps to make baked goods light and fluffy.

name: Sorbic Acid
description: A food preservative used to prevent mold growth in a wide range of food products, including dairy, baked goods, and fruits and vegetables.

name: Sodium Bicarbonate
description: A commonly used leavening agent in baking, used to produce carbon dioxide that helps to make baked goods light and fluffy.
